# description

<OptionalField/>

## Description

Promotion description.






## Validation Rules

- Must be a string
- Must be shorter than `2500` characters


## Example Values

Here are examples of how a valid *description* value should look like in XML.


:::tip Valid Value

```xml
<g:description><![CDATA[Free tote bag with 100.00 USD purchase.]]></g:description>
```

:::

<details>
  <summary>Click to show more valid XML examples</summary>
  <div>

```xml
<g:description><![CDATA[Free tote bag with 100.00 USD purchase.]]></g:description>
```


  </div>
</details>


## Error Codes

Below you will find possible error codes generated when validating this field alongside with an example in XML and CSV that would trigger the code. Please refer to the [validation rules](#validation-rules) to understand the cause.


:::danger <Anchor id="validation_invalid_length" title="validation_invalid_length" />

```xml
<g:description><![CDATA[ (more than 2500 characters value)]]></g:description>
```

:::



## Properties

|     **Property** |         **Value**          | **Description**                                              |
|-----------------:|:--------------------------:|:-------------------------------------------------------------|
|        Data Type |    **string**     | Closest data type in code                                    |
|           Nested |      **False**      | Defines if this field consists of one or more sub-fields     |
|   Case Sensitive |  **True**  | If small or large letters matter for this field              |
|       Repeatable |    **False**    | If you can supply multiple items of this field (itÂ´s a list) |
| Repeatable limit | **0** | If a list, this specifices the max number of items           |
